org.gerstner.oauth2android
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  org.gerstner.oauth2android.Client

public class Client
extends java.lang.Object

In OAuth 2.0 the client is the actual application requesting access to the protected resources of the resource owner. Therefor the service provider needs to assign a unique id to the client clientId and if necessary a secret clientSecret, shared only between client and server, to identify the client (client credentials). After successful identification, the client can request access to the resources, for wich he needs the authorization from the resource owner in form of an access token. This class can contain all necessary parameters regarding the client and its authentification towards the server.

Author:
Christoph Gerstner
See Also:
Server, Token, TokenTypeDefinition

private  Token refreshToken
          Refresh token the client may use to request a new access token, if the previous access token is no longer valid and if the service provider issued a refresh token together with the previous access token.

Field Detail

accessToken

private Token accessToken
Access token the client can use to gain access to the protected resources.

See Also:
TokenTypeDefinition

refreshToken

private Token refreshToken
Refresh token the client may use to request a new access token, if the previous access token is no longer valid and if the service provider issued a refresh token together with the previous access token.

clientId

private java.lang.String clientId
Unique id, identifying the client towards the service provider. It is usually a large randomlike string issued by the service provider after the registration process. The client id can not be used to gain access to the protected resources on its own. Only in combination with an access token or under special circumstances with a client secret
The client id may be issued together with a secret.

See Also:
clientSecret

clientSecret

private java.lang.String clientSecret
The client secret is a shared symetric secret to authenticate the client towards the server. Some service providers may issue a secret for the client to request an access token for the clients own resources. See the OAuth 2.0 specification for more details.

See Also:
clientId

redirectUri

private java.lang.String redirectUri
The redirect uri ist an url the client gets redirected to after each request. For installed applications (or mobile applications) the redirect uri is mostly not a real url directing to a webpage, but a string signaling the server that the client is not capable of redirecting to a webpage. This may be singnaled through the string "oob" (out-of-band). Therefor the client doesn't call the uri on its own but transmits it together with its client credentials.

See Also:
Server

              Token refreshToken,
              java.lang.String clientId,
              java.lang.String clientSecret,
              java.lang.String redirectUri)
Constructs a newly allocated Client object including all values a Client can hold.

Parameters:
accessToken - token to access the protected resources
refreshToken - token for requesting a new access token
clientId - string identifying the client
clientSecret - string verifying the clients id
redirectUri - string containing the url the client will be redirected to
